com.github.ffalcinelli.buffalo.airstation

Class AirStation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.ffalcinelli.buffalo.airstation.AirStation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class AirStation
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable
    AirStation handles the connection to an AirStation device.

    Provides a Java API for the functions exposed by the devices.

    Created by fabio on 24/02/17.

        Parameters:
        params - The parameters map.
        Returns:

      • login

        public org.json.JSONObject login(java.lang.String username,
                                 java.lang.String password)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Open a session to the device by logging in.
        Parameters:
        username - The username (usually "admin").
        password - The password (if it's not been changed set it to "password").
        Returns:
        a JSONObject {"RESULT": "OK"} if all went fine, {"RESULT": "FAIL", "REASON": "..."} otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Whenever something goes wrong communicating with the device.

      • login

        public void login(java.lang.String username,
                  java.lang.String password,
                  AsyncCallback<org.json.JSONObject> callback)
        Open a session to the device by logging in. Asynchronous version of login(String, String) method.
        Parameters:
        username - The username (usually "admin").
        password - The password (if it's not been changed set it to "password").
        callback - The AsyncCallback to use either on success or failure events.

      • setQosPolicy

        public org.json.JSONObject setQosPolicy(java.lang.String policy,
                                        boolean enabled)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Put device in given QOS policy mode if flag enabled is true.
        Parameters:
        policy - The policy to use.
        enabled - Whether to enable or disable the mode.
        Returns:
        A JSONObject with the result: {"RESULT": "OK"} if device received the command.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Whenever something goes wrong communicating with the device.

      • setQosPolicy

        public void setQosPolicy(java.lang.String policy,
                         boolean on,
                         AsyncCallback<org.json.JSONObject> callback)
        Put device in given QOS policy mode if flag enabled is true. Asynchronous version of setQosPolicy(String, boolean) method.
        Parameters:
        policy - The policy to use.
        on - Whether to enable or disable the mode.
        callback - The AsyncCallback to use either on success or failure events.
